alert.note: Alert for Burlington (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 10:51PM EST until December 20 at 4:45AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM EST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southern New Jersey, including the following county, Burlington. * WHEN...Until 500 AM EST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1050 PM EST, Flooding in the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - For Southwest Branch Rancocas at Medford: At 10:30pm the stage was 10.81 feet. Flood Stage is 12 feet. ... For S. Branch Rancocas at Vincentown: At 10:15pm the stage was 8.02 feet. Flood Stage is 7 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
